pullRequest.body:
The `generalize_proofs` tactic had a bug where it would not generalize proofs that appeared under binders correctly, creating terms with fvars from the wrong context. The tactic has been refactored, and it now abstracts the proofs (universally quantifying all the bound variables that appear in the proof) before lifting them to the local context.

This feature can be controlled with the `abstract` option. Using `generalize_proofs (config := { abstract := false })` turns off proof abstraction and leaves alone those proofs that refer to bound variables.

Other new features:
- `generalize_proofs at h` for a let-bound local hypothesis `h` will clear its value.
- `generalize_proofs at h` for a duplicate proposition will eliminate `h` from the local context.
- Proofs are recursively generalized for each new local hypothesis. This can be turned off with `generalize_proofs (config := { maxDepth := 0 })`.
- `generalize_proofs at h` will no longer generalize proofs from the goal.
- The type of the generalized proof is carefully computed by propagating expected types, rather than by using `inferType`. This gives local hypotheses in more useful forms.

(This PR serves as a followup to [this comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/447#issuecomment-1306171602).)

---

nodes.body: @alexjbest Getting this to work was a real slog the last couple of days! It was really really easy to accidentally poison the caches with fvars that weren't supposed to be there.

> @alexjbest Getting this to work was a real slog the last couple of days! It was really really easy to accidentally poison the caches with fvars that weren't supposed to be there.

Interesting, thanks for the hard work fixing this! I will try and take a look tomorrow but it looks good so hopefully we can merge this quickly

Thanks for writing the first version!

If you want to know what the bug was, it's that [mkGen](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/8d0c6e6f821392660468fdce7c5463740d7988be/Mathlib/Tactic/GeneralizeProofs.lean#L47) trusted that `e` didn't refer to any bound variables, so the fvars were being lifted out of the context where they were valid into the local context.

One of the things that turned out to be complex here, vs `Lean.Meta.AbstractNestedProofs`, is that I needed to find a way to interleave visiting the expression and adding new items to the local context (in `AbstractNestedProofs`, it's allowed to create new top-level definitions as it goes, which helps). The solution turned out to be like yours, but I removed the use of `GeneralizeArg` since I didn't want to use the kabstract logic, but rather have it find exact matches and update the local context myself (which seemed necessary to be precise about what was being modified, to exclude touching the goal if that wasn't a location).
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alexjbest.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8872005029/job/24355748723)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8872005029/job/24355748200)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8872005029/job/24355748471)
seems odd to have a debug arg true by default. Maybe its good to have this always on still? But in that case maybe it shouldn't be called debug!

Thanks, I forgot to set it back to `false`. I had that set for the full mathlib build to make sure some invariants were actually holding.

In principle the consistency checks don't do anything, since they're just checking invariants, but in practice I had a lot of trouble making sure the invariants actually held!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: make `generalize_proofs` handle proofs under binders

> @alexjbest Getting this to work was a real slog the last couple of days! It was really really easy to accidentally poison the caches with fvars that weren't supposed to be there.

Interesting, thanks for the hard work fixing this! I will try and take a look tomorrow but it looks good so hopefully we can merge this quickly

Thanks for writing the first version!

If you want to know what the bug was, it's that [mkGen](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/8d0c6e6f821392660468fdce7c5463740d7988be/Mathlib/Tactic/GeneralizeProofs.lean#L47) trusted that `e` didn't refer to any bound variables, so the fvars were being lifted out of the context where they were valid into the local context.

One of the things that turned out to be complex here, vs `Lean.Meta.AbstractNestedProofs`, is that I needed to find a way to interleave visiting the expression and adding new items to the local context (in `AbstractNestedProofs`, it's allowed to create new top-level definitions as it goes, which helps). The solution turned out to be like yours, but I removed the use of `GeneralizeArg` since I didn't want to use the kabstract logic, but rather have it find exact matches and update the local context myself (which seemed necessary to be precise about what was being modified, to exclude touching the goal if that wasn't a location).
